p: Biomass sources of feedstock for biodiesel production could be derived from vegetable oil or animal fat [9]. The oil could be edible or non-edible oil, depending on the acid value of the oil. Oil can be classified as edible if the acid value of the oil is less than 3.00 mg KOH/g oil (%FFA < 1.5), and can successively undergo transesterification reaction with a base, while the non-edible oil acid value must be greater than 3 mg KOH/g oil (%FFA ≥ 1.5), which required acid esterification (H2SO4/HCl) before transesterification with base.
